page.title: 04MOTTRAM HALL HOTEL
page.content: Mottram Hall was built by the Booth family in 1721. Today it is a Hotel owned by De Vere Hotels. Over the years it has grown bigger and today it has 72 bedrooms. Conferences and meetings take place at the Hotel. A twin room costs Â£58.00 per night. The Hotel has beautiful grounds and even a helicopter landing pad which guests can use. Soon the Hotel is having a Leisure Complex with a swimming pool, squash courts and sunbeds. Many stars from sport and entertainment come and stay, the England Cricket team stay while they play Test Matches at Old Trafford, Manchester. About 70 people are employed there. One of the residents the guests would not like to meet is the ghost - the ghost is a lady dressed in blue with a crucifix in her hand. by Lee Connolly and Stuart Barber.
